comment.text:
I am not going to lie, I walked into this place with low expectations.  My friends had dined at another location in the past and had a pretty rough experience, and we were originally going to have Thai food at another place, but I figured, hey, what the hell, why not.  I mean yes, I read all the reviews and such, and I saw the high ratings across the board, but I just kept having reservations (Will it be fresh? Will there be rock hard bread?).  Shame on me!  Needless to say, I am so glad we went, because it was a blessing in disguise.

Located on the main floor of the Hampton Inn on Piedmont (however, it looks like the main entrance is on the outside, not really sure if there is also a way in from the hotel, but I did not check), they have their own marked parking right out front.  We had a dinner reservation for 3, on the patio.  We all went in, and were greeted.  Bar to the right, nice bright dining room with checkered flooring, and then the covered patio.

I heard the menu had consolidated during covid times (as my friend was hoping they had raw oysters), but that was ok, everything I was looking at was screaming, "Tommy, eat me!".  They also have a visual drink menu and dessert (omg) menu- which makes you want to get one of each.  I decided to start off with a bowl ($10.99) of gumbo, and the sriracha ($16.99) chicken, that came with potatoes.  My friend got the cooked oysters, and an okra plate to share.

Our server Jylyn (which thats how it showed on the receipt), I won't lie, he was awesome.  He was one of the friendliest and accommodating servers I have had not only in Atlanta, but anywhere.  LB is very lucky to have him on their team.  When he asked if we had any questions about the menu, I asked about the bourbon chicken- as it came with grits.  I needed to order a togo for mom, and she wanted the chicken with corn and white rice.  I didn't even know if that would be possible, but he said it could happen without any issues at all.

The gumbo came, and along with it, some house hot sauce and crackers.  I mixed everything up, and it was great.  The rice was fresh and the flavors melded well together, with a perfect kick and no shells to worry about either.

Then, the chicken and the okra came.  The okra, I really liked, I almost ate all of them even though I didn't order them, oops.  The chicken, I won't lie, I didn't know what to expect, but when they came out, I was like, "OK", and went to town on them.  The sauce they were topped with, I really liked, you can use that on anything, whatever it was.  Even the potatoes underneath them, I loved- and were great with that same sauce.  It also came with ketchup I threw some hot sauce with and used to switch up when needed.

Jylyn asked if we wanted dessert, we pretty much said shit yes.  I got the praline cheesecake, and for mom to go I got her the bread pudding and the beignets (I gave her crap for wanting 2 desserts lol).  The only real downside to my meal was the cheesecake.  It was excellent, but the praline was so thick, I had to turn it upside down so I wouldn't keep squashing the cheesecake.  I loved it though.  Jylyn then brought us the checks and the togo food.  

My only other regret was I should have tipped him more.  I mean, he got a nice tip, but was so deserving of even more.  I think I will have to come back here honestly.  Those jumbo grilled shrimp, looked like they mean business as well!  

My mom, when I brought her food, she loved everything as well.  I was almost skeptical that she wouldn't since she is very boring when it comes to flavors, but really loved the corn.  I also heard noises from upstairs when she was eating dessert, I assume she enjoyed those.  All in all, this was an excellent experience I was so glad to have, and so unexpected as well!  The reviews don't lie in this one, if you are a fan of cajun (or sweet drinks or yummy desserts), this is not to be missed!  This month, they will be celebrating a year in business at this location (one of 3, the others in Decatur and East Point)- cheers to many more!

Covid notes- it looked like everyone were wearing masks when needed, and also they were doing a nice job sanitizing tables between meals, and spacing out people as needed.  I felt fairly comfortable dining here, especially on the patio.

I ordered the oysters, crab cake and shrimp n grits and all 3 were delicious. Food was flavorful, the shrimp n grits had a spicy kick to them but was not overwhelming. The staff was friendly this was a good dining experience. I will return!

owner_replies.comment: Bryant, thank you for stopping by. It was a pleasure serving you. See you soon!

comment.text: I had one of the worse experiences here. My waitress took 10 minutes to come over. They burnt my salmon then said they'd make me a new one and that one was even more burnt. They were rude and refused to replace the salmon after they promised to make another one. They didn't bring me silverware and the place was dirty I wish I took more pictures of it to show you my surroundings 0/10 would never recommend!!

Visited while in Atlanta.  Was not sure what to expect.  
Had never had Gumbo, Jambalaya or Alligator tails.  
Got say that it was amazing... not sure what it's supposed to taste like but the combination of chicken, sausage and shrimp was great the seasoning was just right. 
I had a peach sangria to drink that was also amazing.  
Would come back if I were to return to Atlanta again.

Pretty tasty creole food. Th Cajun margarita is , so spicy and delicious. I opted for a light dinner and ordered the lump crab cake (full of crab!) the Bistreaux oysters (I've had better, the cheese solidified by the time we got them and the oysters were minuscule) and the Caesar salad (good but lacked seasoning. I had to salt and pepper it to death). My dining companion had the shrimp and grits and a cup of gumbo, they were both decent

I saw a lot of cars outside thought it was busy but it was just the employee's cars. I walked in and there was about 6-7 employees standing at the hostess stand. Then someone acknowledged me a minute later. Being from New Orleans, I'm very picky about places outside of Louisiana that serves my hometown food. I started off with the crab cake and there was barely any crab inside. It was mostly the breading and I didn't even finish it. Then I had the jambalaya for dinner. It looked better than it tasted. It was very salty and I even swallow part of a shrimp shell. I didn't want to make a big deal since it was a little piece. Luckily I didn't have an allergic reaction. I'm allergic to the shell on the shellfish. Sad to say once is enough for me. I'd rather go to Pappadeaux's.

I am thinking this guy/gal -1st.Disgusting (so.sad )  wanted a free meal or just to complain about EVERYTHING 
Should had stuck to Arby's!!

My meal as well as my wife's was incredible and we couldn't e happier

We ate here 6/22/22. We were greeted and shown to our table promptly upon arriving. Our server Mario was very polite and cheerful. We had Gator Bites for an appetizer, they were hot, fresh and delicious. My wife had the Redfish Ponchartrain for her entree, while l had the Crawtator Grouper. The dishes were brought to us in less than 15 minutes. The food was absolutely delicious! Large portions, fresh and bursting with flavor. The beignets for dessert were hot out of the fryer, light, airy and covered with powdered sugar. We both agree that this was one of the best meals that we've ever had in a restaurant. If you are in the Atlanta area and want some authentic Cajun food, this is the place to go.

owner_replies.comment: John, thank you both for stopping by. Mario is an excellent server, and the beignets are always a wonderful choice. We can't wait to serve you again soon!

comment.text: Our waiter "Rich" was phenomenal and made us feel at home! He helped us choose the very best mouthwatering meals! We from Texas and  it!

photos.caption: Mom & Daughter 1 time!! Our Uber driver recommended that we come! Excellent choice!
Carrot Cheesecake had to go back to the hotel we me!

comment.text:
Friday, 11/06/2020 - Trying Louisiana Bistreaux restaurant in Atlanta, GA. Beautiful restaurant! Lots of parking. Place is clean. Staffs are all really nice. Our waitress was Oshianna and she's really nice and professional. She gave us some of the restaurant food recommendations and even took a group photo of us. She's attentive and personable. Awesone customer service! My thoughts on this restaurant?

Pros:
1) place is beautiful and clean.
2) staffs all really nice and smiley. Several said hello to us.
3) waitress professional and nice. She checked on us and gave us drink refills
4) all the foods we ordered was bomb! Full of flavor. See photos. 
5) women's bathroom is very clean and well stocked. There's 2 stalls. Sink clean. 
6) plenty of parking spaces. 

Cons:
1) no cons!

Conclusion:
I would come here again and bring friends. I recommend it! We had a good experience and I hope you do too. Food and staffs were great.

I've been here and have order from Uber eats a lot but last night , when I took my daughter there for her birthday and we brought are own cake , they told us it's $50 to bring it in, I spent over $630 with them, which includes the $50 bring in your own cake fee, I'm not ordering or going back anymore

The customer service was a 5 so I wish I could change this review but the food. So being from Louisiana I got a craving for some red beans and rice. Again the service was amazing but the food was cold and there was more sausage than red beans and rice.

Great food with a great atmosphere. Was by myself for a business trip, but I didn't feel out of place. The server did a great job, and her recommendation was spot on. Had the blackened redfish Pontchartrain. Highly recommended.

Excellent Bread Pudding and carrot cake!! 
We mostly order desserts from this place and was never disappointed.

Food was great but took forever to get the food and when they did bring it out they pretty much brought the app and entree out at the same time. Very busy so make a reservation. 

I had the redfish pontchartrain (I think that's what gosh it was) and the broiled oysters with crab meat.

I've never been to Atlanta before and as a foodie I wanted to only eat things I could not get in Arizona.

I'm a fan of Cajun cuisine so when my cousin suggested this place I was very excited.

Now for the folks who eat here regularly they no longer have their infamous bread. Upon hearing this my cousin looked like she was about to burst into tears. Apparently this bread is next level delicious and the thought that her family would be missing out on tasting it brought her to tears.

I hope they get the bread back soon as many of the customers told me the same thing and they were devastated.

Our server was hilarious. He joked he also cried about the bread as well.

I'm pleased to report there was nothing that got served that wasn't delicious. Every single entree that hit our table was absolutely wonderful. 

Now I would say the lamb chops were the talk of the table and my cousin obliged each of us by breaking off a small piece of the tender meat so no one missed out.

So if you're unsure of what to order you won't be disappointed if you get the lamb chops

I had a chance to check out Louisiana Bistreaux for a Saturday lunch. When I arrived around 2pm on a Saturday I was surprised it was not packed and was able to grab a seat at the bar. The bar tender was great and provided great recommendations and customer service! She was awesome! I ordered the hurricane for a drink which was Pre made but surprising good. I ordered the oysters for my appetizer and they were good and flavorful. i did feel like I did see they had a lot of oil/grease in them which was not okay to me. For my entree I ordered the shrimp étouffée, which was good as well since they did not have my first choice. I will say I wasn't wowed by the food but it was good. I will come back to check out some of their other items but honestly they won't be first on my list.

I wouldn't recommend this place. We came on a Sunday for brunch when things weren't very busy. The table ordered various fish dishes and grilled oysters. The oysters came hot but lacked flavor. I didn't even finish them all. The fish had good flavor but came cold. There were 4 of us dining and we all agreed that this place served its purpose for that day but we wouldn't go back ever again.

If you look in my reviews you will noticed that I had crab cakes from this restaurant before, at a different location. I was excited to find that there was a buckhead location, because it's close to my job. The first time I visited this location I was delighted with my crab cakes. The second time I had them which was yesterday I was highly disappointed. They came out looking burnt. At first I thought maybe that didn't mean anything... but I'm sure it definitely scorched the taste. Also, this time around the meat didn't taste fresh... 

I don't know if coming earlier in the day differs from coming in towards the evening hours... but management should really have a conversation with their chef about consistency. Im like traumatized lol, don't want to order them again.

I wish I would've spoken to management while I was there, but along with being dissatisfied & tired I had after 5 Atlanta traffic to deal with lol. Thought this second visit was going to make the drive better.

Each time I've been at this location I sat at the bar. i haven't sat in the main dine area, each time I've visited this location I sat t the bar. I think that the bartenders shouldn't cross service whom they're serving. Not sure how tips work, but this happened during the second visit. Overall the service is moderate, and the environment is nice. 

Just highly disappointed with the crab cakes I had today. Check the photos below.

photos.caption: First Tim's I had the crab cake at this location
Second time I had a crab cake at this location

comment.text: Great experience, good service, good food. Highly recommend for a New Orleans experience in Atlanta. If you find yourself in Georgia make sure to visit.

photos.caption: Red beans and rice with smoked turkey sausages.

owner_replies.comment: Jesse, thank you for sharing your positive experience. It was a pleasure serving you!

comment.text: First time visiting, food was great also the drinks, service was also very good, I like to sit at the bar and take my time ordering, never felt rushed.

Convenient parking. Awesome menu, but I wish I ordered something different than what I did. My own fault. I got the crawfish stuffed burger because it sounded interesting but it wasn't as good as I hoped - the crawfish was overpowered by the burger meat. Hopefully I'll get to come back here someday and try something else. Service was good but the food took a long time to come.

owner_replies.comment: Linda, thank you for sharing your experience. It was an honor serving you. We hope to serve you again!

comment.text: The food was a 9-10 the service a 1-2. We made a reservation ONE WEEK in advance for 14 people and confirmed TWICE the day of. When we arrived they had no clue who we were and the table was not ready. We waited 20 minutes for them to arrange the tables. The restaurant was almost empty so this was ridiculous. We arrived at 5:55pm for a 6:00pm reservation, did not get seated until 6:20pm and did not get our first cocktail until 7:00pm. Again the restaurant was empty so this was just unacceptable. The food was authentic and delicious - but once we got our entrees they never checked on us again. Never asked if we wanted dessert and never brought us the bill. After 30 minutes I went and asked for the bill. It was a shame because the food was fantastic - this is what happens when gratuity is automatically included! They should be ashamed.

A gem of you are craving that Nola food! I had the gator bites which were perfectly seasoned and crispy. For the entree , I had the crawfish dish and it was great. It could've been more spicy, but very tasty. Highly recommend!

Had a bday party for my mom who was visiting from New York.  Everyone enjoyed the entire experience.  Took a while for us to set up the tables, but everything turned out fabulously! The private room was just the right size for 20 people,  the wait staff was friendly,  polite and enjoyable and the food was delicious. 
Thank you sooo much!
Amazing food and drinks! Parking was easy to find. There was construction across from the entrance but wasn't noisy at all. Great service as well! I will definitely return

owner_replies.comment: Christa, it was a pleasure serving you. See you soon!

comment.text:
Maybe I was expecting more but I enjoyed my experiences better at the South Atlanta and Decatur locations. 

Customer service will more than likely be the downfall in this area. It's in a great, high traffic location. 

I came in around 9:40pm. By 9:46pm no one had greeted me so I decided to sit at the bar. My bartender was Jomari who was responsible for taking my order. I only learned her name from the receipt not because she introduced herself. She did say hello when I walked in to the bar area though but her overall service was very dry which was offsetting and unwelcoming. Even other patrons seemed less than thrilled about her service. She didn't check in with you like is everything OK, do you need anything else. I had to flag her down when I was ready for my order with strong eye contact which she acknowledged by saying "I'll be with you," ask for ice water when my mixed drink was finished. I ordered the NOLA daiquiri which I don't recommend. Not much liquor and had a strange aftertaste. I think it was the juice they used. I notice they had some juices from a can. Yikes! I wish I ordered The Hurricane instead but her response when I questioned about the two drinks was "they're both sweet". She didn't help with any recommendations. She just seemed like she was ready to go home. 

One thing I like about this restaurant is that they continue serving until closing time. I had called before coming to ensure I would still be able to order and I was told yes. The kitchen is open up until close which is 10pm. 

I ordered the gator bites appetizer which is good but I wouldn't recommend ordering if Uber Eats or food delivery because it will be cold and hard by time it arrives to you. I also crawtator grouper which was good with the jalapeño grits. Very tasty! I think they messed up and attempted to serve it to go but I heard the bartender say it was ordered as a dine so I noticed the manager take the bag back and reappear with my dish a few minutes later. Luckily it wasn't thrown around. Presentation still looked good and manager (I presume he was the manager) asked me did everything look OK which I said yes. 

I noticed this menu didn't have the stuffed burger with crawfish. Parking is valet only. The parking lot directly in front of LA Fitness is shut down currently for construction. Then there is some garage parking but at night by yourself wouldn't recommend. Also not sure if the garage is connected to the restaurant that you don't have to walk on the Main Street to get to the restaurant. 

I wanted to

photos.caption: Receipt when I learned my bartender/server's name

owner_replies.comment: Darlene, thank you for your feedback. It helps us get better. We hope to see you soon!

comment.text: From the ambiance, to the service, to the food, this was honestly one of the best experiences all around. I ordered the shrimp, andouille sausage, and grits and that was literally the best meal I've ever had in my life. My daughter tried gator tail for the first time and actually really enjoyed it, I was shook. I wish I could remember our server's name, he was incredible. He told us about how he was singing with his band the next day in South Carolina and we even convinced him to sing for us. My goodness, did he ever serenade us. I wish I was on this side of the country more, I would eat here at least once a week.

photos.caption: Shrimp, andouille sausage, and jalapeño Gouda grits
Gator tail bites with a spicy sauce

owner_replies.comment: Jessica, thank you for visiting. We are delighted to know that you both enjoyed your experience.

comment.text:
Really good food here! Glad I found this place while I was in the Buckhead area. I've always wanted to try them out but their airport location (Virginia ave.?) was just too far from me. I was promptly seated outside and greeted by a friendly server. I ordered the redfish with corn and sub dirty rice for white rice. I also had the shrimp and crab that comes on top of the dish, on the side since I don't eat shrimp. The meal was delicious. The fish was flaky and tender and the crab was a perfect touch to round out the dish. 

 They also have cocktails which was really tasty (Lemon Drop martini). I will come back here for sure, plus there was plenty of parking which is not the norm for Buckhead.

We visited the bar for drinks and appetizers late on 7/30/23; also asked for a side house salad (lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, etc) which the waitresses just didn't quite understand or provide. They looked at us like we had two heads. House salads were not on the menu (go figure) but we didn't think it was too much to ask the chef to throw one together, especially since there was hardly no one  in the restaurant. So we agreed on a Caesar salad which had wilted lettuce and not very tasty. Furthermore, the customer service was lacking; Not friendly or accommodating. However our drinks were good. This will be our last visit to this establishment considering that there are so many other choices in the area.

Had a lovely lunch at Louisiana Bistreaux's Buckhead location. The restaurant specializes in Cajun cuisine as the name suggests. We ordered the fried catfish which is served with potatoes and slaw as well as the seafood etouffee. Delicious. Definitely needed a nap after we ate! The service was great as well, and we sat on the patio. Servings were enough for 2. Parking was plentiful in the lots surrounding the location.

This review is about 2 month delayed but better late than never. After spending a day at Lenox Mall, we were pretty hungry (and tired) so after a bit of Yelp searching we happened across this place. There was a 20 minute wait but it was worth it. Our server was a huge plus (funny, attentive and energetic) but the food is the main attraction. I had the Hurricane for my drink and in our never ending search for good oysters we tried the Bistreaux Oysters as our appetizer, which was pretty good and I actually recommend you try that one. For the main dish I selected the Redfish Ponchartrain while my wife had the Cajun Jambalaya. While the Jambalaya was good, the redfish was unbelievable and my wife doesn't like fish but she tried mine and decided then and there that she would have that dish next time we finished. They seasoned and grilled that fish perfectly.
Of course, a good dining experience requires a good dessert so we chose the classic beignets which came fresh and extremely hot. I would recommend this spot to anyone; didn't take more than one photo because we were pretty tired and hungry.

owner_replies.comment: Kareem, thank you for both for visiting. We are happy to know that we exceeded your expectations. Thank you for recommending us to other guests. See you soon!

comment.text: Really good food, service was great and drinks are good too. The place was decorated pretty and my seat had a mirror so I kept looking at myself

We came here as a family. We just so happened had taken our kids to Candytopia. As we were leaving we saw this restaurant and decided to stop by and give it a try. 

The ambiance was pretty cool, our service was great, my only issue was the food. It was just ok. Everything was extremely spicy.  

The best part of our meal were the beignets. They were delicious!!
Called in for carryout. Very nice hostess,  please hold while I transfer you to the bar.  Stated wanted to place a pickup order.  Order ready and check upon arrival. Thank you Chris

photos.caption: Cost of 3 desserts, coffee with a shot of Jack Daniel's with Honey

owner_replies.comment: Yolanda, thank you for the five star rating. Our main goal is to provide stellar service. We look forward to serving you again soon!

comment.text:
This restaurant went above and beyond expectations. The food and customer service was great. Saia was our server and she made so many suggestions. The fried lobster tail was very good. All the food was fresh. Very good Location. Me and hubby will definitely be back. Pricing was great.
Diane Mendez
2/11/2023
Awesome place! Gumbo was too salty.  The crawfish platter was awesome!  Fried crawfish done right, etouffe was perfect!  Beans and rice nice.  Service was great! Will be coming back!

The food here is DELICIOUS. Highly recommend the crawtator grouper- it's the chef's creation and such a comfort food with some complex flavors and textures. 

Damon had excellent service- our glasses were always full and it felt like a really upscale experience due to his level of attention to our table during a busy time.

photos.caption: Classic Caesar with shrimp // Crawtator Grouper

comment.text: Called in a to-go order of lamb chops and red beans and rice. The lamb chops were so good, and they came with a side of jalapeno grits. Both were absolutely delicious. Wasn't a fan of the red beans and rice though. I ended up not eating it, but the lamb chops and grits were really good.

owner_replies.comment: Simone, thank you for the five star rating. We are happy to learn that you enjoyed the Lamb Chops. See you soon!

comment.text: Pick up parking is hell. They sent me gumbo when I ordered red beans. I'm allergic to seafood so I had to immediately toss. Likely will mot order from this location again.
Delightful.!!! Service was outstanding .!! Food was delicious.. we had gator bites, crawfish etouffee, lamb. Beer wine and mixed drinks.

photos.caption: Gator bites were delicious. Tastefully done.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for sharing your positive experience. We truly appreciate it!

comment.text:
The service was horrible.  Reservations followed up on and confirmed twice.  And it was a clear surprise when we showed up... Place of the time was empty yet we had to wait for quite a while. The server was incredibly slow beverages took 20 minutes at least to arrive after ordering the food was reasonably authentic, I can definitely recommend the gumbo Jambalaya was not up to my standards as a former resident of Louisiana... But was an overall crowd pleaser my group of about 12 enjoyed the food but the excessive waiting cost them business people would have ordered dessert. I had someone come back within a reasonable time of them dropping containers on the table should we want to take any food home... Dishes weren't cleared, second drinks weren't an option to order online dessert

An 18% gratuity was built in so there wasn't even any way to incentivize better service 

Definitely order takeout only the restaurants in the midst of some updating, but that was not the issue at all.

The service is terrible but the food is really good. After I was seated no one acknowledged me or took my order for 20 minutes. I decided to leave due to having other things to handle in the following hour. Keep in mind there were inly 2 other tables seated, when I got there two staff members weren't doing anything while the other two took care of the one table they had each and ignored me. I wish I could talk about the food but the bad service outshined any good meal I had.

My friend told me about this newly opened restaurant. She said she would walk over to my condo so we could walk together there.

We girls walked over this afternoon. It was a short walk and today's weather was just great! 

Prior to visiting, I have briefly looked through the yelps reviews and learned this restaurant serves Cajun food. 

AMBIENCE 5/5
I like the bright interior. I wish they have booths that accommodate more than a party of two. The current booth seatings look tight. Overall I like the vibe here.

FOOD 5/5
I ordered the shrimp po' boy ($10.99)and my lunch buddy had a fried catfish po' boy ($10.99). 
The food portion was generous and the shrimps was simply fresh and delicious. The baguette was so crispy and the potatoes on the side were tasty. I heard the fried catfish po' boy was wonderful too.

I also ordered a cup of gumbo soup which had a generous amount of sausages and shrimps. However, I probably could not take the heat. Somewhat too spicy for me.

SERVICE 5/5
Our server Courtnay was nice and attentive. She came back and checked on us in the middle of our lunch. Not only she thanked us before we left, while heading for the door, the staff at the bar and another gentleman (possibly manager?) thanked us for our visit.

This lunch was a pleasant surprise for me. I was more like expecting my lunch to be just good but nothing out of this world. However, my lunch experience at Louisiana Bistreaux was just amazing! That shrimp po' boy was simply to die for. I am definitely returning here for another round of po' boy :D

What a pleasant surprise this spot was. I was in the Buckhead area and in need of a  place for lunch. This restaurant was in close proximity to where I was located so I decided to give it a try. 

This restaurant is located in the shopping center with LA fitness. It's at the top of the shopping plaza,  near Rooms to go. They do have dedicated parking that is clearly marked. 

When we walked in we were immediately greeted by about threes ladies. The restaurant was not crowded so we were immediately seated. The ambiance is sophisticated, but not  stuffy. The decor includes contrasting colors, for example white walls with black trim, checker board floor with red walls for the bar area, which also includes bistro style seating. There are also beautiful light fixture, and of course the decor is complimented with hints of New Orleans flavor! You have to give credit to the masked faces on the walls.

Our server was nice. She provided us with prompt service and also helped us decided what to order. My date and I decided to order the fried okra as an appetizer. A bowl of gumbo, corn chowder and the Grouper Orleans served as our main course. I am a pescatarian, so I did not try the gumbo. The corn chowder  had a very  rich taste, I am sure it is loaded with calories.  We were both pretty full after enjoying the  bowls of gumbo and chowder so we only tried the grouper dish and took the rest to go. It was really good. I did have to add a little salt and pepper to it.  I did not try dessert ( I am saying no to sweets for 30 days). However, they all look amazing. I will have to come back to try the bread pudding.  

Overall I enjoyed my visit. Service met my expectations, the food quality was good and it did not break the bank. I am looking forward to patronizing this restaurant in the future.

Ok food at a high price. Gator bites were decent. Catfish was a little dried out and over fried. Shrimp and grits and the crawfish ravioli were basically a soup. Shrimp were undercooked and overall flavorless. Ravioli were really good but again it was floating in a bowl of sauce soup. Service was nonexistent. Barely saw the waitress. We were done eating, stacked our plates, and sat for a good 10-15 minutes before she finally showed up for the check. Food was decent but it and the service were not worth the price.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to email us at getsocial@levelup.social. We'd love an opportunity to wow you. I'm sorry this experience was not the best. This is not our normal standard of service.

comment.text: The customer service was awesome. The food was first class and the vibes were everything. Definitely will be my go to spot in the ATL.

owner_replies.comment: Chauncee, thank you for the five star rating. We look forward to you becoming a regular!

comment.text:
This is one of my Atlanta favorites. This was my first time coming to this location but the service was great. We  came in for Sunday lunch and ordered the bbq shrimp appetizer, Caesar salad, catfish poboy and shrimp
Poboy. We loved eVerything. The bbq shrimp only came with 4 very large shrimp so that was disappointing because they're so good and hard to share only four. 

The poboys came out very hot and fresh with seafood that wasn't too heavily breafed. the bread also tasted like it was made in house and not a generic roll you get from some places. 

I will definitely continue to come back but will be ordering my own order of bbq shrimp!

service was very poor, food was fair. Definitely not what we expected. The live music was extremely loud. decor was sparse overall a very poor experience.
won't go back!

Parking - there is a pay lot but the first 2 hours are free and you can add time as needed which I appreciated.

Food - we went for the oysters and were not disappointed however they need to serve more and at a better price point because half a dozen for like $14 is STEEP; we also dined on the lamb chops which comes with grits and sautéed spinach and although also pretty pricey at $30 it was seasoned well but the temp was not medium as the server told me that is the only way they serve it; the grouper orleans appeared at almost every table outside while we dined and everyone seemed to enjoy it - my nephew did; 

Drinks - we tried a NOLA daiquiri and it was not a daiquiri even in the slightest regard (out of 5 I'd give it a 2 although alcohol was clearly present it just didn't stand up to the name for me); the hurricane was ok but needed a bit more flavor, and after that I tried a rum punch which also was just blah.  

I can see myself visiting maybe on someone else's dime and deserve to go but I can't see myself going on a random Saturday to spend $300 for 3 people again just because.

Service - our server was taking care of every table outside and although he told us upfront he was a great server I beg to differ - he came to our table singing and just wasn't very attentive but we tipped him well anyway.  He also did not wear his mask the entire time working around people, food, etc as they should be.

Restrooms were clear but there is only like 2 stalls and that can be a problem once the world opens back up as we are still in covid times.  

Overall this place isn't bad but I'm a NOLA girl and this just didn't feel like NOLA food or hospitality to me.
